question.title: Jakarta Persistence (JPA) Specification for a join
question.body:
I cannot get this JPA Specification to work for a simple join. I know the ""statusLookup.code" when mapping but does not work here. Does anyone know how to get it to work. Its a document class, a status class and the specification class. I have left out the decorators for the tables but if it wasn't for the specification then the code works.

public class Document {
  @Id
  @Column(name = "id")
  private UUID id;

  @OneToOne(fetch = FetchType.LAZY)
  @JoinColumn(name = "status_id", referencedColumnName = "id")
  private Status statusLookup;

  @Column(name = "document_description")
  private String documentDescription;
}

public class Status {
  @Id
  @Column(columnDefinition = "UUID")
  private UUID id;
   
  @Column(name = "code")
  private String code;

  @Column(name = "description")
  private String description;
}

public class DocumentSpecification {
  public static Specification<Document> isStatus(String status) {
    return (root, query, builder) -> {
      return builder.equal(root.get("statusLookup.code"), status);
    };
  }
}
